basic.floral_language:
Sansevieria trifasciata var. harnii 
Floriography: dedication, Tough, fortitude
Sansevieria cylindrica is an evergreen foliage plant, has stripes along both sides of the leaf blade like a tiger's tail.
Sansevieria trifasciata var. harnii is pretty with hypertrophy leaves in a tufted erect form, the surface is leathery with dense stipes of gray, yellow and dark green colors alternately arranged. Usually put in the study, living room, bedroom, is a common indoor potted foliage plant.
Sansevieria trifasciata var. harnii likes the gentle sunlight, but no direct strong sunlight. Blooms sometimes with white flowers.
basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowers in November-December, white flowers
basic.color: Leaf color gray white, pale yellow and dark green in mixture

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Resistant to half shade, likes moderate sunshine, avoid direct strong light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, dilute fertilizers following instructions,  in early summer, spring and autumn apply fertilizers once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead, yellowish and disease leaves timely
